item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Wednesday, January 29, 2025 at 11:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. An update on Dart macros and data serialization (79 points | 50 comments)
2. Exposed DeepSeek database leaking sensitive information, including chat history (93 points | 28 comments)
3. An analysis of DeepSeek's R1-Zero and R1 (323 points | 135 comments)
4. SmolGPT: A minimal PyTorch implementation for training a small LLM from scratch (154 points | 23 comments)
5. Building a T1D smartwatch for my son from scratch (135 points | 18 comments)
6. OpenAI says it has evidence DeepSeek used its model to train competitor (340 points | 1078 comments)
7. Soviet Shoe Factory Principle (33 points | 12 comments)
8. Parsing PDFs (and more) in Elixir using Rust (29 points | 7 comments)
9. From C++ to Clojure: Jank language promises best of both (17 points | 4 comments)
10. NordVPN says its new protocol can circumvent VPN blockers (25 points | 15 comments)
11. A major Postgres upgrade with zero downtime (69 points | 26 comments)
12. Keymapper: A cross-platform context-aware key remapper (22 points | 8 comments)
13. Ötzi the Lyme Mummy (2019) (61 points | 21 comments)
14. Making the video that made Gorillaz (117 points | 26 comments)
15. Bacteria (and their metabolites) and depression (364 points | 161 comments)

18. Frigade (YC W23) is hiring engineer #2 ( | hide)
19. Airflow – Stream media files directly from macOS to AirPlay devices (34 points | 15 comments)
20. Cardan grille (26 points | discuss)
21. Asteroid Impact on Earth 2032 with Probability 1% and 8Mt Energy (149 points | 137 comments)
22. Dead Games (95 points | 29 comments)
23. Society for Technical Communication to permanently close its doors (64 points | 20 comments)
24. "We're building a new static type checker for Python" (212 points | 100 comments)
25. Meta Reports Fourth Quarter and Full Year 2024 Results (7 points | 1 comment)
26. Adding iodine to salt played a role in cognitive improvements: research (2013) (170 points | 109 comments)
27. Vim Roadmap 2025 (29 points | 12 comments)
28. I still like Sublime Text (934 points | 491 comments)
29. Show HN: Mcp-Agent – Build effective agents with Model Context Protocol (42 points | 7 comments)
30. A story about restoring and upgrading a Commodore Amiga 1000 (114 points | 31 comments)
